note.title: This is UI-Only Work
note.content: All backend OAuth configuration is already complete from EPIC-09. This story only adds the missing buttons to the sign-up form. No changes needed to auth.ts, auth-client.ts, or environment variables. Simply replicate the sign-in form's OAuth buttons in the sign-up form.

note.title: Pattern Consistency
note.content: The sign-in-form.tsx file is the reference implementation. Copy the exact pattern for state management, handlers, and button structure. Only difference: use "sign-up" instead of "sign-in" in error messages and console logs.

note.title: Button Placement
note.content: Insert Microsoft and GitHub buttons within the existing space-y-3 div that contains the Google button. Maintain the order: Google → Microsoft → GitHub → Divider → Email form. This matches the sign-in page layout.

note.title: Error Message Wording
note.content: Sign-up form uses more descriptive error messages than sign-in form. Sign-in uses generic "OAUTH_ERROR" constant. Sign-up uses string: "Unable to sign up with [Provider]. Please try again or use email registration." Follow sign-up form's existing Google OAuth error message pattern.

note.title: Loading State Management
note.content: All three OAuth buttons must be disabled when any one is loading. This prevents concurrent OAuth operations and race conditions. Update Google button's disabled prop to include isMicrosoftLoading and isGitHubLoading.

consideration.title: OAuth Security Already Implemented
consideration.description: All OAuth security measures are in the backend configuration from Stories 09-1 and 09-2. Account linking is secured via email verification. Tokens are stored securely in the Account model. This story only adds UI buttons - no security changes needed.

consideration.title: Error Message Safety
consideration.description: Use generic error messages that don't leak provider-specific details. Follow the existing pattern from Google OAuth in sign-up form. Don't expose whether an account exists or other sensitive information.
